The analysts kept their recommendation on the stock at "neutral."

column4: UPDATE 3-Ex-Microsoft executive  ex-McDonald's CEO join HP board
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK  July 15 Hewlett-Packard Co on Monday appointed three big-name directors  including former Microsoft Corp software chief Raymond Ozzie and former McDonald's Corp Chief Executive James Skinner  as the struggling PC maker searches for a chairman and addresses top-level stumbles of past years.

column4: ISS urges vote against four McKesson directors over CEO pay
column5: NEW YORK Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) is urging shareholders of McKesson Corp  to vote against the re-election of four directors  citing the firm's persistent problems in addressing shareholders' concerns about executive compensation.

column4: UPDATE 2-ISS urges vote against four McKesson directors over CEO pay
column5: * McKesson has agreed to install a lead independent director

column4: Proxy adviser ISS urges vote against four McKesson directors: WSJ
column5: NEW YORK Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services is urging shareholders of McKesson Corp  to vote against the re-election of four directors  citing the firm's persistent problems in addressing shareholders' concerns about executive compensation  The Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

column4: Proxy adviser ISS urges vote against four McKesson directors-WSJ
column5: NEW YORK  July 14 Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services is urging shareholders of McKesson Corp to vote against the re-election of four directors  citing the firm's persistent problems in addressing shareholders' concerns about executive compensation  The Wall Street Journal said on Sunday.

column4: Navistar avoids proxy battle by giving Icahn  Rachesky more say
column5: Navistar International Corp  signed a new deal giving activist investors Carl Icahn and Mark Rachesky one more seat on its board  in a move that staves off a proxy contest and gives management more time to turn around the struggling truck and engine maker.

column4: Navistar avoids proxy battle by giving Icahn  Rachesky more say
column5: July 15 Navistar International Corp  signed a new deal giving activist investors Carl Icahn and Mark Rachesky one more seat on its board  in a move that staves off a proxy contest and gives management more time to turn around the struggling truck and engine maker.

column4: Pfizer gets fresh cancer drug rejection from UK cost body
column5: LONDON  July 16 Pfizer's new chronic myeloid leukaemia drug Bosulif - also known as bosutinib - is too expensive to be used by Britain's state health service  the country's cost agency NICE said on Tuesday.

column4: INDIA PRESS-Regulator rejects Reliance's $3.5 bln plan for NEC-25 gas - PTI in Business Standard
column5: Tech Mahindra likely to buy Polaris' IT services business - Business Standard

column4: Fluor lands design work for Sasol U.S. chemical plant
column5: July 15 Fluor Corp secured the front-end engineering and design work for a chemicals plant in Louisiana being built by South Africa's Sasol Ltd aimed at putting cheap U.S. natural gas liquids to use.

column4: UPDATE 1-Seadrill orders four new ultra-deepwater rigs
column5: * Seadrill says no need to raise equity capital or cut div   (Adds detail)

column4: Loblaw to buy Shoppers in C$12.4 billion bid to defend turf
column5: Loblaw Cos Ltd   Canada's largest food retailer  announced a C$12.4 billion ($11.9 billion) deal on Monday to buy Shoppers Drug Mart Corp   the country's biggest pharmacy chain  to bulk up against intensifying competition.

column4: UPDATE 4-Loblaw to buy Shoppers in C$12.4 bln bid to defend turf
column5: * Canadian retailers face competition from Wal-Mart  Target

column5: July 15 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1330 GMT on Monday:

column4: Telecom Italia wants favorable regulation to go ahead with spinoff
column5: MILAN Telecom Italia said on Monday it wanted to secure favorable regulatory conditions before taking any steps forward in its plan to spin off its fixed-line network after the local regulator cut tariffs its rivals pay to access the grid.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telecom Italia wants favorable regulation to go ahead with spinoff
column5: MILAN  July 15 Telecom Italia said on Monday it wanted to secure favorable regulatory conditions before taking any steps forward in its plan to spin off its fixed-line network after the local regulator cut tariffs its rivals pay to access the grid.

column4: RPT-Telecom Italia to review regulatory developments before spin-off
column5: MILAN  July 15 Italian phone company Telecom Italia said on Monday it will review regulatory developments before proceeding with the spin-off of its fixed-line network after the local regulator cut tariffs to access the grid.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telecom Italia may abandon spin-off in tariff row-source
column5: ROME/MILAN  July 15 Italian phone company Telecom Italia could halt its plan to spin off its fixed-line network  a source familiar with the matter said on Monday  as a row over tariffs with the local regulator heats up.

column4: Telecom Italia board meets after grid fee row -sources
column5: MILAN  July 15 Italian phone company Telecom Italia has called an extraordinary board meeting in Rome on Monday afternoon  two sources close to the matter said without providing details.

column4: Modest rise in retail sales offers cautionary economic note
column5: WASHINGTON Retail sales rose less than expected in June  the latest sign of a slowdown in economic growth that offers a cautionary note to the Federal Reserve as it mulls scaling back its monetary stimulus. | Video

column4: Teen Spieth wins John Deere Classic on fifth playoff hole
column5: Teenager Jordan Spieth won the John Deere Classic on the fifth hole of a three-man  sudden-death playoff on Sunday to become the youngest player to win on the PGA Tour since 1931.

column4: Fitch Affirms YUM!Brand's IDRs at 'BBB/F2'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  July 15 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the Issuer Default Ratings  (IDRs) and issue level ratings of YUM! Brand's (NYSE: YUM) as follows: --Long-term IDR at 'BBB'; --Senior unsecured notes at 'BBB'; --Short-term IDR at 'F2'. The Rating Outlook is Stable.
